text:
HI Matteo, I'm a fan of this <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/key-concepts|CMS Overview> page. It includes sections on how Themes, Templates, and Modules fit together, and also a section on HubL. Here also is a link to the main <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/key-concepts|HubL> page in the docs.

Besides the docs, the CMS for Developers course you're taking is probably your best bet. <https://academy.HubSpot.com/courses/cms-best-practices-for-developers|CMS Best Practices for Developers> is also a recent course that launched that might be helpful.

If you're just looking for some code examples, the <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-theme-boilerplate/tree/main/src|HubSpot CMS Boilerplate Theme> is a great starting point.

Let me know if this is helpful.. happy to provide some additional resources if you need them.

Your domain name would be your website address without the https://

Example: <http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com>

If you have a business email address, itâ€™s probably the same domain you see there.
<mailto:example@HubSpot.com|example@HubSpot.com>
the domain would be <http://HubSpot.com|HubSpot.com>
